title: Spatio-temporal structural and functional studies into the novel interaction between LIMD1 and clathrin heavy chain proteins
abstractText: We have identified the LIMD1 gene that may be damaged or lost in many human diseases and cancers. In order to determine why this protein is so important for human health we performed experiment to determine how this protein functions. We subsequently discovered that LIMD1 interacts with a subset of proteins the function of which is to regulate a critical cellular process called endocytosis. Thus LIMD1's ability to regulate cell growth and proliferation could be through novel interactions with key regulators of endocytosis.
impactText: The findings from this work have uncovered key new data on the basic molecular biology of disease. These will have impact in the long term in the clinical setting. Healthcare,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology Societal
findingsText: We have discovered new cellular biology that may be important for human and animal health that relates to how the body controls how proteins. Understanding the precise mechanism of microRNA-silencing means we can better understand many cellular regulatory processes. Also this knowledge can be use by higher education centre, and by the healthcare industry (in the long term). Education,Healthcare,Manufacturing, including Industrial Biotechology
